page.title: 02FECKENHAM VILLAGE
page.content: The village of Feckenham is extremly picturesque. It is built around a village green or square. The church is on one side of the green with a pub on the other. All around the green are small pretty cottages. The village is quite densly populated, with many houses and cottages fronting straight onto the road. The village has an active social life, revolving around the church, village hall and First School. The First School is situated some distance from the village, not adjacent to the church as you would expect for a Church School. The houses vary in age from before the last Domesday survey to brand new. Many houses and cottages have been recently renovated and modernised. There is also the site of KING JOHN'S royal Hunting lodge.
